results.title: Hurricane circuit
results.brief_description: Shows how the warning centre at Miami, Florida, reduces hurrican menace in the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico. The operation of the warning system, precautions against damage, rescue and relief measures, and international aspects of the warning system. The nature of hurricanes is shown by animation.

results.title: Huon's new harvest
results.brief_description: The construction of a wood pulping factory in southern Tasmania. How the great eucalypt forests are managed, huge logs converted to pulp pellets, and then these pellets are shipped to Sydney where strong packaging paper is manufactured for supply to fibreboard container manufacturers.

results.title: Hunters of the North Pole
results.creator_credit: Nils Rasmussen, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A glimpse of life as far north as it can be lived, with scenes of walrus, seal and polar-bear hunts. Taking us northward to Greenland, the camera records the year’s round for the Inuit of Thule. In the lengthening daylight of spring, they cross the sea ice by dog sled in quest of seal and polar bear, racing towards land with their catch as the ice bridge begins to melt and crack. When the autumn days shorten, the hunters, in final preparation for the months of Arctic night, set out in boats to harpoon walrus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nils Rasmussen, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Hunter (D)
results.brief_description: Set in the farming district of the Coolah Valley, New South Wales, this short fictional film is an indictment of the senseless and indiscriminate shooting of kangaroos, purportedly for sport or recreational value, which sometimes takes place out in the Australian bush. With John Shellabear. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES.

results.title: Hunt for a cancer killer
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer, Michael Sklar and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: A graphic account of science’s determined search for a chemical cure for cancer, outlining the promising work being done in the field of antibiotics. Includes interviews with scientists and visits to scientific laboratories and hospitals where tests and experiments are being carried out to produce a cancer-killing compound without harming healthy tissues.

results.title: Lon Chaney: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
A condensed version of the classic silent film of the Victor Hugo novel which was a masterpiece of film-making. Shows details of Lon Chaney’s elaborate makeup for his role as the hunchback Quasimodo and ends with an epilogue in tribute to the remarkable star. Dubbed “The man of a thousand faces”, Chaney’s portrayal of Quasimodo is not the only outstanding feature of this production. The set which took a year to build, the enormous cast of extras and night photography adds to the epic grandeur of the film which also starred Brandon Hurst, Nigel De Brulier and Patsy Ruth Miller as Esmeralda.

results.title: The Human skeleton. Part 2. Muscles, movement and posture
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Shows by live-action, animated diagram and radiology, the position, attachment, and function of the muscles relative to the bones and joints; the movements of the arm and of respiration; and the action of the muscles in maintaining posture in the standing and moving positions.

results.title: Human reproduction. - [2nd. ed.]
results.brief_description: A very clear exposition of human reproduction mainly by the use of animated diagrams showing the male and female reproductive organs, the menstrual cycle, fertilisation and growth of a fetus over the nine months of pregnancy.
